column5: Does anyone know of a store in the Lindsay/Peterborough area that has a good stock of reef runners.  I had someone go to Gagnon's for me, but very little stock was left.  Heading to Quinte next week and would like to get a couple. Thanks, Jimmer
Hey Jimmer,  Which one are you mostly use? I never used them before. i saw full bunch of them in BPS. Thanks.

Haven't used them before.  I heard that they work well in deeper water, so I wanted to try them.  I was looking for the 800 series. BPS is a little far for me to drive to buy a couple of lures.  It's just too dangerous to go into that store without dropping mega bucks.

When you are heading up there, check the CT in Kingston.  I know their fishing selection was like no other CT I have seen in my life.  Actually was quite impressed and better than alot of tackle stores I have gone to.  But I don't recall if they sold Reef Runners.  Might be worth a check? Baker's in Nappannee may have some, but I doubt it, he usually sell's his own home-made cranks.
http://www.protacklemuskyshop.com/   Huge selection of Reef Runners, if you can stop in on your way.  Try purples and blues.
Damn, I didn't know about that place!  Thx Frankie.  Looks like you're set Jimmer!
Stacey has a HUGE selection in stock now. Prices are good too.
Hey Frankie, I think Jimmer is targeting walleye not sheeps. Stay away from the purple and blues jimmer. Try taildancers too they work for me
Go to toplak's tackle and get them sent to you.  Great prices and only $3.50 for shipping.  I bought 4 from him this month. http://www.toplakstackle.com/

Yeah man - I'd have to say, on-line is the way to go.  There's always a better selection and you can almost always find exactly what you want.  Yeah, there's shipping, and a wait.  But I think it's the way to go, a lot of the time.
Pro Tackle also has custom colours you won't find anywhere else
Just checked out Protackle - nifty stuff. Thanks for the 411.
